title.narrative: Energy Utility Performance and Reliability Improvement Project

description.narrative: To improve the operational performance of the Borrower's national electricity utility and improve the reliability of electricity supply in the Project Area.

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: The Borrower and the Project Implementing Entity shall enter into a Subsidiary Agreement, under terms and conditions approved bythe Bank. (Section I.B of Schedule 2 to the Loan Agreement and Section I.B of the Schedule to the Project Agreement)

The Borrower shall carry out, jointly with the Project Implementing Entity and the Bank, not later than three years after theEffective Date, or such other period as may be agreed with the Bank, a mid-term review of the Project. (Section II.2 of Schedule 2to the Loan Agreement and Section II.B to the Schedule to the Project Agreement)

The Borrower shall cause the Project Implementing Entity to, and the Project Implementing Entity shall, maintain, throughout theProject implementation period, an independent panel of experts, with terms of reference, composition, and personnel possessingqualifications and experience satisfactory to the Bank, responsible for reviewing and advising the Project Implementing Entity onmatters relating to dam safety and other critical aspects of dam construction, rehabilitation and operation, all to support andinform the relevant activities being undertaken under Part 3 of the Project and in accordance with the details set out in the ESMF.(Section I.C.8 of Schedule 2 to the Loan Agreement and Section I.E.8 of the Schedule to the Project Agreement)

The Borrower shall, by not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, establish and thereafter maintain throughoutProject implementation period, a Project Steering Committee, with terms of reference, composition and resources satisfactory to theBank, which shall be: (a) responsible for, inter alia, overseeing progress of Project implementation and ensuring coordinatedefforts by all relevant stakeholders on Project implementation; and (b) composed of members as described in the Project OperationalManual. (Section I.A.1 of Schedule 2 to the Loan Agreement)

The Project Implementing Entity shall maintain, throughout the Project implementation period, a Project Implementation Team, withterms of reference, composition and resources satisfactory to the Bank, which shall be responsible for carrying out day-to-dayimplementation of the Project. (Section I.A.1 of the Schedule to the Project Agreement)

The Project Implementing Entity shall prepare and furnish to the Bank, by not later than three months after the Effective Date andNovember 30 of each subsequent year during the implementation of the Project, for the Bank’s review and no-objection, an AnnualWorkPlan and Budget for the Project. The Project Implementing Entity shall ensure that the Project is implemented in accordancewith the Annual Work Plan and Budget accepted by the Bank for the respective fiscal year. (Sections I.D.1 and I.D.2 of the Scheduleto the Project Agreement)

The Project Implementing Entity shall: (a) by not later than three months after the Effective Date, prepare and adopt a ProjectOperational Manual; and (b) thereafter ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance with the Project Operational Manual.(Sections I.C.1 and I.C.2 of the Schedule to the Project Agreement)

The Project Implementing Entity shall: (a) by not later than three months after the Effective Date, recruit or appoint, at aminimum, the following positions within the Project Implementation Team: (i) a Project manager; (ii) a procurement specialist;(iii) an environmental and social safeguards specialist; and (iv) a financial management specialist, each with terms of reference,qualifications and experience satisfactory to the Bank; and (b) thereafter maintain such positions throughout the Projectimplementation period (Section I.A.2 of the Schedule to the Project Agreement)

title.narrative: Project Steering Committee meets regularly to discuss project implementation status
Length of distribution lines constructed or rehabilitated through the project
Transmission capacity installed or rehabilitated through the project
Percentage of total sales (KWh) covered by the Revenue Protection Program (RPP)
Customers with advanced metering infrastructure financed under the project
Yearly system average interruption duration index (SAIDI)
Percentage of women in technical and managerial roles within PPL
Progress towards identification and implementation of recommendations of the gender safety audit
Installation of Management Information Systems (MIS) at PPL, and populated with data

target.value: All systems in MIS set functioning and used for PPL’s operations and internal and external monitoring and reporting

title.narrative: Key studies launched for least-cost power generation investment
PPL publishes (annual) report on customer satisfaction surveys, including actions adopted to respond to customer concerns
Project preparatory studies for NBHPP completed
